citations.narrative:
A ground transport vehicle delivering pigs from Illinois to South Carolina was unable to make visual observations of the
animals every four hours. Though drivers were able to stop in three-hour-intervals initially in the route, the overnight stop
occurred five hours after the 11:23pm break.
Routine and thorough visual assessments of all animals during transport are necessary to assess for any signs of
respiratory compromise, injuries, or any additional signs of distress that may have emerged during transport.
During surface transportation, it shall be the responsibility of the driver or other employee to visually observe the pigs as
frequently as circumstances may dictate, but not less than once every 4 hours, to assure that they are receiving sufficient
air for normal breathing, their ambient temperatures are within the prescribed limits, and all other applicable standards are
being complied with.
Correct by September 20, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives and registrant.
